verses.verse: And <WG2532> it came to pass <WG1096> <WG5633>, as <WG1722> he <WG846> went <WG2064> <WG5629> into <WG1519> the house <WG3624> of one <WG5100> of the chief <WG758> P'rushim <WG5330> to eat <WG5315> <WG5629> bread <WG740> on the sabbath <WG4521> day, that <WG2532> they <WG846> watched <WG2258> <WG5713> <WG3906> <WG5734> him <WG846>.
And <WG2532>, behold <WG2400> <WG5628>, there was <WG2258> <WG5713> a certain <WG5100> man <WG444> before <WG1715> him <WG846> which had the dropsy <WG5203>.

And <WG2532> Yeshuw`a <WG2424> answering <WG611> <WG5679> spake <WG2036> <WG5627> unto <WG4314> the Torahyers <WG3544> and <WG2532> P'rushim <WG5330>, saying <WG3004> <WG5723>, Is it <WG1487> Torahful <WG1832> <WG5748> to heal <WG2323> <WG5721> on the sabbath day <WG4521>?
And <WG1161> they held their peace <WG2270> <WG5656>. And <WG2532> he took <WG1949> <WG5637> him, and healed <WG2390> <WG5662> him <WG846>, and <WG2532> let him go <WG630> <WG5656>;

And <WG2532> they could <WG2480> <WG5656> not <WG3756> answer <WG470> him <WG846> again <WG470> <WG5677> to <WG4314> these things <WG5023>.

And <WG1161> he put forth <WG3004> <WG5707> a parable <WG3850> to <WG4314> those which were bidden <WG2564> <WG5772>, when he marked <WG1907> <WG5723> how <WG4459> they chose out <WG1586> <WG5710> the chief rooms <WG4411>; saying <WG3004> <WG5723> unto <WG4314> them <WG846>,

When <WG3752> thou art bidden <WG2564> <WG5686> of <WG5259> any <WG5100> man to <WG1519> a wedding <WG1062>, sit <WG2625> not <WG3361> down <WG2625> <WG5686> in <WG1519> the highest room <WG4411>; lest <WG3379> a more honourable man <WG1784> than thou <WG4675> be <WG5600> <WG5753> bidden <WG2564> <WG5772> of <WG5259> him <WG846>;

And <WG2532> he that bade <WG2564> <WG5660> thee <WG4571> and <WG2532> him <WG846> come <WG2064> <WG5631> and say <WG2046> <WG5692> to thee <WG4671>, Give <WG1325> <WG5628> this man <WG5129> place <WG5117>; and <WG2532> <WG5119> thou begin <WG756> <WG5672> with <WG3326> shame <WG152> to take <WG2722> <WG5721> the lowest <WG2078> room <WG5117>.

But <WG235> when <WG3752> thou art bidden <WG2564> <WG5686>, go <WG4198> <WG5679> and sit down <WG377> <WG5657> in <WG1519> the lowest <WG2078> room <WG5117>; that <WG2443> when <WG3752> he that bade <WG2564> <WG5761> thee <WG4571> cometh <WG2064> <WG5632>, he may say <WG2036> <WG5632> unto thee <WG4671>, Friend <WG5384>, go up <WG4320> <WG5628> higher <WG511>: then <WG5119> shalt thou <WG4671> have <WG2071> <WG5704> worship <WG1391> in the presence <WG1799> of them that sit at meat <WG4873> <WG5740> with thee <WG4671>.

For <WG3754> whosoever <WG3956> exalteth <WG5312> <WG5723> himself <WG1438> shall be abased <WG5013> <WG5701>; and <WG2532> he that humbleth <WG5013> <WG5723> himself <WG1438> shall be exalted <WG5312> <WG5701>.

Then <WG1161> said he <WG3004> <WG5707> also <WG2532> to him that bade <WG2564> <WG5761> him <WG846>, When <WG3752> thou makest <WG4160> <WG5725> a dinner <WG712> or <WG2228> a supper <WG1173>, call <WG5455> <WG5720> not <WG3361> thy <WG4675> friends <WG5384>, nor <WG3366> thy <WG4675> brethren <WG80>, neither <WG3366> thy <WG4675> kinsmen <WG4773>, nor <WG3366> thy rich <WG4145> neighbours <WG1069>; lest <WG3379> they <WG846> also <WG2532> bid <WG479> thee <WG4571> again <WG479> <WG5661>, and <WG2532> a recompence <WG468> be made <WG1096> <WG5638> thee <WG4671>.
But <WG235> when <WG3752> thou makest <WG4160> <WG5725> a feast <WG1403>, call <WG2564> <WG5720> the poor <WG4434>, the maimed <WG376>, the lame <WG5560>, the blind <WG5185>:

And <WG2532> thou shalt be <WG2071> <WG5704> blessed <WG3107>; for <WG3754> they cannot <WG3756> <WG2192> <WG5719> recompense <WG467> <WG5629> thee <WG4671>: for <WG1063> thou <WG4671> shalt be recompensed <WG467> <WG5701> at <WG1722> the resurrection <WG386> of the just <WG1342>.

And <WG1161> when one <WG5100> of them that sat at meat with him <WG4873> <WG5740> heard <WG191> <WG5660> these things <WG5023>, he said <WG2036> <WG5627> unto him <WG846>, Blessed <WG3107> is he <WG3739> that shall eat <WG5315> <WG5695> bread <WG740> in <WG1722> the kingdom <WG932> of 'Elohim <WG2316>.
Then <WG1161> said he <WG2036> <WG5627> unto him <WG846>, A certain <WG5100> man <WG444> made <WG4160> <WG5656> a great <WG3173> supper <WG1173>, and <WG2532> bade <WG2564> <WG5656> many <WG4183>:

And <WG2532> sent <WG649> <WG5656> his <WG846> servant <WG1401> at supper <WG1173> time <WG5610> to say <WG2036> <WG5629> to them that were bidden <WG2564> <WG5772>, Come <WG2064> <WG5737>; for <WG3754> all things <WG3956> are <WG2076> <WG5748> now <WG2235> ready <WG2092>.

And <WG2532> they all <WG3956> with <WG575> one <WG3391> consent began <WG756> <WG5662> to make excuse <WG3868> <WG5738>. The first <WG4413> said <WG2036> <WG5627> unto him <WG846>, I have bought <WG59> <WG5656> a piece of ground <WG68>, and <WG2532> I must <WG2192> <WG5719> needs <WG318> go <WG1831> <WG5629> and <WG2532> see <WG1492> <WG5629> it <WG846>: I pray <WG2065> <WG5719> thee <WG4571> have <WG2192> <WG5720> me <WG3165> excused <WG3868> <WG5772>.

And <WG2532> another <WG2087> said <WG2036> <WG5627>, I have bought <WG59> <WG5656> five <WG4002> yoke <WG2201> of oxen <WG1016>, and <WG2532> I go <WG4198> <WG5736> to prove <WG1381> <WG5658> them <WG846>: I pray <WG2065> <WG5719> thee <WG4571> have <WG2192> <WG5720> me <WG3165> excused <WG3868> <WG5772>.

And <WG2532> another <WG2087> said <WG2036> <WG5627>, I have married <WG1060> <WG5656> a wife <WG1135>, and <WG2532> therefore <WG1223> <WG5124> I cannot <WG3756> <WG1410> <WG5736> come <WG2064> <WG5629>.

So <WG2532> that <WG1565> servant <WG1401> came <WG3854> <WG5637>, and shewed <WG518> <WG5656> his <WG846> lord <WG2962> these things <WG5023>. Then <WG5119> the master of the house <WG3617> being angry <WG3710> <WG5685> said <WG2036> <WG5627> to his <WG846> servant <WG1401>, Go out <WG1831> <WG5628> quickly <WG5030> into <WG1519> the streets <WG4113> and <WG2532> lanes <WG4505> of the city <WG4172>, and <WG2532> bring in <WG1521> <WG5628> hither <WG5602> the poor <WG4434>, and <WG2532> the maimed <WG376>, and <WG2532> the halt <WG5560>, and <WG2532> the blind <WG5185>.

And <WG2532> the servant <WG1401> said <WG2036> <WG5627>, YY <WG2962>, it is done <WG1096> <WG5754> as <WG5613> thou hast commanded <WG2004> <WG5656>, and <WG2532> yet <WG2089> there is <WG2076> <WG5748> room <WG5117>.

And <WG2532> the lord <WG2962> said <WG2036> <WG5627> unto <WG4314> the servant <WG1401>, Go out <WG1831> <WG5628> into <WG1519> the highways <WG3598> and <WG2532> hedges <WG5418>, and <WG2532> compel <WG315> <WG5657> them to come in <WG1525> <WG5629>, that <WG2443> my <WG3450> house <WG3624> may be filled <WG1072> <WG5686>.

For <WG1063> I say <WG3004> <WG5719> unto you <WG5213>, That <WG3754> none <WG3762> of those <WG1565> men <WG435> which <WG3588> were bidden <WG2564> <WG5772> shall taste <WG1089> <WG5695> of my <WG3450> supper <WG1173>.
And <WG1161> there went <WG4848> <WG5711> great <WG4183> multitudes <WG3793> with him <WG846>: and <WG2532> he turned <WG4762> <WG5651>, and said <WG2036> <WG5627> unto <WG4314> them <WG846>,

If any <WG1536> man come <WG2064> <WG5736> to <WG4314> me <WG3165>, and <WG2532> hate <WG3404> <WG5719> not <WG3756> his <WG1438> father <WG3962>, and <WG2532> mother <WG3384>, and <WG2532> wife <WG1135>, and <WG2532> children <WG5043>, and <WG2532> brethren <WG80>, and <WG2532> sisters <WG79>, yea <WG2089>, and <WG1161> his own <WG1438> life <WG5590> also <WG2532>, he cannot <WG3756> <WG1410> <WG5736> be <WG1511> <WG5750> my <WG3450> Talmid <WG3101>.

For <WG1063> which <WG5101> of <WG1537> you <WG5216>, intending <WG2309> <WG5723> to build <WG3618> <WG5658> a tower <WG4444>, sitteth <WG2523> not <WG3780> down <WG2523> <WG5660> first <WG4412>, and counteth <WG5585> <WG5719> the cost <WG1160>, whether <WG1487> he have <WG2192> <WG5719> sufficient to <WG4314> finish <WG535> it ?

Lest <WG3363> haply <WG3379>, after he <WG846> hath laid <WG5087> <WG5631> the foundation <WG2310>, and <WG2532> is <WG2480> not <WG3361> able <WG2480> <WG5723> to finish <WG1615> <WG5658> it, all <WG3956> that behold <WG2334> <WG5723> it begin <WG756> <WG5672> to mock <WG1702> <WG5721> him <WG846>,

Saying <WG3004> <WG5723>, This <WG3754> <WG3778> man <WG444> began <WG756> <WG5662> to build <WG3618> <WG5721>, and <WG2532> was <WG2480> not <WG3756> able <WG2480> <WG5656> to finish <WG1615> <WG5658>.

Or <WG2228> what <WG5101> king <WG935>, going <WG4198> <WG5740> to make <WG4820> <WG5629> war <WG4171> against <WG1519> another <WG2087> king <WG935>, sitteth <WG2523> not <WG3780> down <WG2523> <WG5660> first <WG4412>, and consulteth <WG1011> <WG5736> whether <WG1487> he be <WG2076> <WG5748> able <WG1415> with <WG1722> ten <WG1176> thousand <WG5505> to meet <WG528> <WG5658> him that cometh <WG2064> <WG5740> against <WG1909> him <WG846> with <WG3326> twenty <WG1501> thousand <WG5505>?

Or else <WG1490>, while the other <WG846> is <WG5607> <WG5752> yet <WG2089> a great way off <WG4206>, he sendeth <WG649> <WG5660> an ambassage <WG4242>, and desireth <WG2065> <WG5719> conditions <WG4314> of peace <WG1515>.

So <WG3779> likewise <WG3767>, whosoever <WG3956> he be of <WG1537> you <WG5216> that <WG3739> forsaketh <WG657> <WG5731> not <WG3756> all <WG3956> that he hath <WG5224> <WG5723> <WG1438>, he cannot <WG3756> <WG1410> <WG5736> be <WG1511> <WG5750> my <WG3450> Talmid <WG3101>.
Salt <WG217> is good <WG2570>: but <WG1161> if <WG1437> the salt <WG217> have lost his savour <WG3471> <WG5686>, wherewith <WG1722> <WG5101> shall it be seasoned <WG741> <WG5701>?

It is <WG2076> <WG5748> neither <WG3777> fit <WG2111> for <WG1519> the land <WG1093>, nor yet <WG3777> for <WG1519> the dunghill <WG2874>; but men cast <WG906> <WG5719> it <WG846> out <WG1854>. He that hath <WG2192> <WG5723> ears <WG3775> to hear <WG191> <WG5721>, let him hear <WG191> <WG5720>.
